teleop_arm_key.cpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 // =============================================================================
00002 // Name   : teleop_arm_key.cpp
00003 // Author : Jonathan Hasenzahl
00004 // Date   : 2012
00005 //
00006 // Implements the ROS node "teleop_arm_key". This node accepts keyboard input to
00007 // pass commands to the "arm_control" node. The code used for getting input from
00008 // the keyboard was originally found in teleop_turtle_key.cpp inside the
00009 // "turtlesim" package on ros.org.
00010 // =============================================================================
00011 
00012 #include "arm/teleop_arm_key.h"
00013 #include "arm/movement_definitions.h"
00014 #include <signal.h>
00015 #include <termios.h>
00016 #include <stdio.h>
00017 
00018 int kfd = 0;
00019 struct termios cooked, raw;
00020 
00021 TeleopArmKey::TeleopArmKey()
00022 {
00023     cmd_pub_ = n_.advertise<arm::constant_move>("constant_moves", 1);
00024     cmd_.states.fill(0);
00025     cmd_.speeds.fill(0);
00026     cmd_.query = false;
00027     cmd_.quit = false;
00028     init();
00029 }
00030 
00031 void TeleopArmKey::init()
00032 {
00033     // Wait for a subscriber to "constant_moves" before continuing
00034     ROS_INFO("Waiting for subscriber...");
00035     while (cmd_pub_.getNumSubscribers() < 1 && ros::ok());
00036     keyLoop();
00037 }
00038 
00039 void TeleopArmKey::keyLoop()
00040 {
00041     // Get the console in raw mode
00042     tcgetattr(kfd, &cooked);
00043     memcpy(&raw, &cooked, sizeof(struct termios));
00044     raw.c_lflag &=~ (ICANON | ECHO);
00045     
00046     // Setting a new line, then end of file                         
00047     raw.c_cc[VEOL] = 1;
00048     raw.c_cc[VEOF] = 2;
00049     tcsetattr(kfd, TCSANOW, &raw);
00050 
00051     printf("\nNow reading from the keyboard.\n");
00052     printf("Use the keyboard to move the ARM.\n");
00053     printf("Take care not to exceed its range of motion!\n");
00054     
00055     char input;
00056     bool shutdown = false;
00057     bool new_command = false;
00058 
00059     // Continue only while shutdown flag has not been enabled and there is still
00060     // a subscriber to receive messages
00061     while (!shutdown && cmd_pub_.getNumSubscribers() > 0 && ros::ok())
00062     {
00063         // Get the next event from the keyboard  
00064         if(read(kfd, &input, 1) < 0)
00065         {
00066             perror("read():");
00067             exit(-1);
00068         }
00069       
00070         //printf("Key value: 0x%02X\n", input);
00071         new_command = getCommand(input);
00072       
00073         if (new_command)
00074         {
00075             cmd_pub_.publish(cmd_);
00076 
00077             if (cmd_.query)
00078                 cmd_.query = false;
00079             if (cmd_.quit)
00080                 shutdown = true;
00081 
00082             new_command = false;
00083         }
00084     }
00085 }
00086 
00087 bool TeleopArmKey::getCommand(const char c)
00088 {
00089     bool new_command = true;
00090     switch (c)
00091     {
00092     case KEYCODE_BACKSPACE:
00093         cmd_.states.fill(0);
00094         cmd_.speeds.fill(0);
00095         break;
00096 
00097     // Arm control
00098     case KEYCODE_W:
00099         cmd_.states[X] = cmd_.states[X] == ARM_FORWARD ? STOP :
00100                              ARM_FORWARD;
00101         break;
00102     case KEYCODE_A:
00103         cmd_.states[Y] = cmd_.states[Y] == ARM_LEFT ? STOP : ARM_LEFT;
00104         break;
00105     case KEYCODE_S:
00106         cmd_.states[X] = cmd_.states[X] == ARM_BACKWARD ? STOP :
00107                              ARM_BACKWARD;
00108         break;
00109     case KEYCODE_D:
00110         cmd_.states[Y] = cmd_.states[Y] == ARM_RIGHT ? STOP : ARM_RIGHT;
00111         break;
00112     case KEYCODE_Z:
00113         cmd_.states[Z] = cmd_.states[Z] == ARM_UP ? STOP : ARM_UP;
00114         break;
00115     case KEYCODE_X:
00116         cmd_.states[Z] = cmd_.states[Z] == ARM_DOWN ? STOP : ARM_DOWN;
00117         break;
00118     case KEYCODE_F:
00119         // Fold: not implemented
00120         new_command = false;
00121         break;
00122     case KEYCODE_U:
00123         // Unfold: not implemented
00124         new_command = false;
00125         break;
00126     
00127     // Claw control     
00128     case KEYCODE_NUM_4:
00129         cmd_.states[YAW] = cmd_.states[YAW] == CLAW_YAW_LEFT ? STOP :
00130                                 CLAW_YAW_LEFT;
00131         break;
00132     case KEYCODE_NUM_6:
00133         cmd_.states[YAW] = cmd_.states[YAW] == CLAW_YAW_RIGHT ? STOP :
00134                                 CLAW_YAW_RIGHT;
00135         break;
00136     case KEYCODE_NUM_8:
00137         cmd_.states[PITCH] = cmd_.states[PITCH] == CLAW_PITCH_UP ?
00138                                   STOP : CLAW_PITCH_UP;
00139         break;
00140     case KEYCODE_NUM_2:
00141         cmd_.states[PITCH] = cmd_.states[PITCH] == CLAW_PITCH_DOWN ?
00142                                   STOP : CLAW_PITCH_DOWN;
00143         break;
00144     case KEYCODE_NUM_7:
00145         cmd_.states[ROLL] = cmd_.states[ROLL] == CLAW_ROLL_LEFT ?
00146                                  STOP : CLAW_ROLL_LEFT;
00147         break;
00148     case KEYCODE_NUM_9:
00149         cmd_.states[ROLL] = cmd_.states[ROLL] == CLAW_ROLL_RIGHT ?
00150                                  STOP : CLAW_ROLL_RIGHT;
00151         break;
00152     case KEYCODE_NUM_MINUS:
00153         cmd_.states[GRIP] = cmd_.states[GRIP] == CLAW_GRIP_CLOSE ?
00154                                  STOP : CLAW_GRIP_CLOSE;
00155         break;
00156     case KEYCODE_NUM_PLUS:
00157         cmd_.states[GRIP] = cmd_.states[GRIP] == CLAW_GRIP_OPEN ?
00158                                  STOP : CLAW_GRIP_OPEN;
00159         break;
00160     
00161     // Lift control    
00162     case KEYCODE_UP:
00163         cmd_.states[LIFT] = cmd_.states[LIFT] == LIFT_UP ? STOP :
00164                                  LIFT_UP;
00165         break;
00166     case KEYCODE_DOWN:
00167         cmd_.states[LIFT] = cmd_.states[LIFT] == LIFT_DOWN ? STOP :
00168                                  LIFT_DOWN;
00169         break;
00170        
00171     // Other
00172     case KEYCODE_COMMA:
00173         // Currently affects all speeds at once
00174         if (cmd_.speeds[0] > 0)
00175         {
00176             for (int i = 0; i < SPD_ARR_SZ; i++)
00177                 cmd_.speeds[i]--;
00178         }
00179         else
00180             new_command = false;
00181 
00182         printf("Speed[%d]\n", cmd_.speeds[0]);
00183         break;
00184     case KEYCODE_PERIOD:
00185         // Currently affects all speeds at once
00186         if (cmd_.speeds[0] < 4)
00187         {
00188             for (int i = 0; i < SPD_ARR_SZ; i++)
00189                 cmd_.speeds[i]++;
00190         }
00191         else
00192             new_command = false;
00193 
00194         printf("Speed[%d]\n", cmd_.speeds[0]);
00195         break;
00196     case KEYCODE_TAB:
00197         print();
00198         cmd_.query = true;
00199         break;
00200     case KEYCODE_Q:
00201         cmd_.states.fill(0);
00202         cmd_.quit = true;
00203         break;
00204     default:
00205         new_command = false;
00206         break;
00207     }
00208 
00209     return new_command;
00210 }
00211 
00212 void TeleopArmKey::print()
00213 {
00214     printf("\nX[%d] Y[%d] Z[%d]\n", cmd_.states[1], cmd_.states[2],
00215            cmd_.states[0]);
00216     printf("Yaw[%d] Pitch[%d] Roll[%d] Grip[%d]\n", cmd_.states[3],
00217            cmd_.states[4], cmd_.states[5], cmd_.states[6]);
00218     printf("Lift[%d] Speed[%d]\n", cmd_.states[7], cmd_.speeds[0]);
00219 }
00220 
00221 void quit(int sig)
00222 {
00223     tcsetattr(kfd, TCSANOW, &cooked);
00224     exit(0);
00225 }
00226 
00227 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00228 {
00229     signal(SIGINT, quit);
00230     
00231     ros::init(argc, argv, "teleop_arm_key");
00232     TeleopArmKey teleop_arm_key;
00233     ros::shutdown(); // To allow arm_control node to shutdown
00234     return 0;
00235 }
